definitions: deep feeling of sadness or regret about something that has happened or been done
bitter-tasting herb plant with small yellow flowers used in traditional medicine
examples: He felt deep rue for the harsh words he spoke
Looking back with rue, she wished she had made different choices
The garden path was lined with fragrant rue plants
Medieval healers often used rue in their remedies

definitions: stiff pleated circular collar worn around the neck in sixteenth and seventeenth centuries
medium-sized wading bird with elaborate neck feathers displayed during breeding season
small freshwater fish found in rivers and lakes across Europe
examples: The portrait showed a nobleman wearing an elaborate white ruff
She dressed as Queen Elizabeth with a jeweled ruff around her neck
The male ruff displayed his colorful feathers to attract mates
Birdwatchers spotted several ruffs feeding in the wetland
The angler caught a small ruff while fishing for perch
Ruff are common bottom-dwelling fish in European waters

definitions: violent person who commits crimes and behaves in a rough aggressive manner
examples: The ruffian threatened passersby in the dark alley
A gang of ruffians terrorized the neighborhood until police intervened

definitions: thick fabric floor covering smaller than a carpet typically used in specific areas
examples: She placed a colorful Persian rug in the living room
The bathroom rug needs to be washed after getting wet

definitions: team sport played with oval ball involving running tackling and passing to score points
examples: The rugby match between England and Wales was intensely competitive
He joined the university rugby team to stay fit

definitions: process of causing complete destruction damage or collapse to something previously intact or valuable
examples: The constant rain was ruining the outdoor wedding plans
His reckless spending was slowly ruining the family business

definitions: straight flat instrument marked with units for measuring length and drawing lines
person who governs a country or territory with supreme authority and power
examples: She used a ruler to draw perfectly straight lines
The student measured the paper with a twelve-inch ruler
The ruler decreed new laws for the kingdom
Queen Elizabeth was a beloved ruler of England

definitions: period during which someone rules as leader or the quality of governing with authority
examples: His rulership lasted for twenty prosperous years
The kingdom flourished under her wise and just rulership

definitions: strong alcoholic drink made from fermented sugarcane juice or molasses typically from Caribbean regions
examples: The pirates celebrated with bottles of Caribbean rum
She ordered a rum and cola at the beach bar

definitions: rhythmic ballroom dance of Cuban origin characterized by hip movements and syncopated steps
examples: They performed an energetic rumba at the dance competition
The couple took rumba lessons every Thursday evening

definitions: deep continuous rolling sound like distant thunder or heavy machinery
informal fight between rival gangs or groups especially in streets
examples: The rumble of thunder warned of approaching storms
We heard the rumble of trucks passing on the highway
The teenage gangs planned a rumble after school
Police broke up the rumble before anyone was seriously hurt

definitions: continuous deep resonant sound suggesting movement or disturbance often from machinery or nature
examples: The rumbling of the volcano made residents nervous
Strange rumbling noises came from the old heating system

definitions: process of thinking deeply and carefully about something over extended period often repeatedly
examples: After much rumination, she decided to change careers
His philosophical rumination on life filled several notebooks

definitions: card game where players form sets and sequences to score points and eliminate cards
examples: The family played rummy every Sunday afternoon
She won three rounds of rummy in a row

definitions: story or piece of information passed between people that may not be true or confirmed
examples: The rumour about company layoffs spread quickly through the office
Don't believe every rumour you hear at school

definitions: hind part of a mammal especially the buttocks or bottom area
small remaining part of something larger that was divided or diminished
examples: The butcher prepared a tender rump roast for dinner
The horse swished its tail across its rump
Only a rump of the original committee remained active
The rump parliament continued meeting after many members left

definitions: small light motor vehicle or boat designed for short trips and easy maneuvering
examples: They used the runabout for quick trips around town
The family's small runabout boat was perfect for lake fishing

definitions: person especially a young person who has run away from home or institution
examples: The police found the teenage runaway at the bus station
The shelter provided meals and beds for young runaways

definitions: brief summary giving main points or facts about a situation or topic
state of being in poor condition through neglect or deterioration over time
examples: Give me a quick rundown of today's meeting agenda
The coach provided a rundown of the game strategy
The rundown neighborhood needed major urban renewal investment
Years of neglect left the building in complete rundown

definitions: letter of ancient Germanic alphabets used for inscriptions and believed to have magical properties
examples: The archaeologist discovered Viking runes carved into stone
Each rune in the alphabet had symbolic meaning

definitions: horizontal crosspiece forming a step on a ladder or similar climbing structure
examples: He carefully tested each rung before climbing higher
The bottom rung of the ladder was broken

definitions: water from rain or melted snow that flows over ground surface into streams
additional election held when no candidate receives required majority in first vote
examples: Heavy rainfall created dangerous runoff in the streets
Agricultural runoff polluted the nearby river
The mayoral race went to a runoff election
Neither candidate won enough votes to avoid a runoff

definitions: smallest or weakest member of a litter or group often struggling to survive
examples: The runt of the litter needed extra care and feeding
Despite being the runt, the puppy grew strong and healthy

definitions: long flat paved surface where aircraft take off and land at airports
examples: The pilot aligned the plane with the runway for landing
Snow removal crews cleared the airport runway overnight

definitions: basic monetary unit used in India Pakistan and several other South Asian countries
examples: The price was five hundred rupees at the Delhi market
She exchanged dollars for rupees at the airport

definitions: sudden breaking or bursting of something under pressure or strain
medical condition where organ or tissue breaks through containing wall especially hernia
examples: The water pipe rupture flooded the basement
Excessive pressure caused a rupture in the fuel tank
The patient required surgery to repair an abdominal rupture
Heavy lifting can sometimes cause a hernia rupture

definitions: clever trick or deceptive strategy intended to deceive or mislead someone
examples: The spy used an elaborate ruse to obtain secret documents
Her illness was just a ruse to avoid the meeting

definitions: person who moves with urgent haste or rushes forward especially in sports
examples: The pass rusher sacked the quarterback three times
Morning rushers crowded onto the subway platform

definitions: act of moving with urgent speed or doing something hastily without proper preparation
examples: The rushing of water over rocks created white rapids
Rushing through homework often leads to careless mistakes

definitions: reddish-brown color like autumn leaves or certain types of apples
variety of potato with brown skin and white flesh good for baking
examples: The trees turned beautiful shades of russet in fall
She wore a russet-colored sweater that matched her hair
Russet potatoes make the fluffiest baked potatoes
The farmer harvested tons of russet potatoes this season

definitions: reddish-brown coating formed on iron or steel when exposed to moisture and oxygen
fungal plant disease causing reddish or brownish spots on leaves and stems
examples: The old car had rust spreading across its doors
Regular painting prevents rust from forming on metal
Wheat rust disease destroyed much of the crop
The gardener treated roses for rust infection

definitions: person from the countryside with simple unsophisticated manners or rural lifestyle characteristics
examples: The rustic welcomed visitors to his mountain cabin
City dwellers often romanticize the life of a rustic

definitions: gradual process of iron or steel corroding through exposure to oxygen and moisture
examples: The rusting of the bridge supports concerned engineers
Prevent rusting by keeping metal tools dry and oiled

definitions: soft crackling or whispering sound made by things moving or rubbing together
illegal practice of stealing cattle or livestock especially in western regions
examples: The rustling of leaves announced someone's approach
We heard rustling in the bushes near our campsite
Cattle rustling was punishable by hanging in the Old West
Modern rustling involves trucks rather than horses

definitions: deep groove or track worn into ground by repeated wheel passage
fixed routine or pattern of behavior that becomes tedious and hard to change
examples: The wagon wheels carved deep ruts in the muddy road
Rain filled the ruts making driving difficult
She felt stuck in a rut with her daily routine
Taking a vacation helped him break out of his rut

definitions: hardy cereal grain used for making bread flour whiskey and animal feed
examples: The farmer planted rye as a winter cover crop
Dark rye bread has a distinctive tangy flavor

definitions: period of paid leave granted for study research or travel typically to university professors
examples: The professor took a sabbatical to write her book
During his sabbatical, he conducted research in Japan

definitions: heavy cavalry sword with curved blade and single cutting edge used historically in warfare
examples: The cavalry officer drew his saber during the charge
Antique sabers decorated the military museum walls

definitions: small carnivorous mammal valued for its dark luxurious fur found in northern forests
color of deep black especially used in heraldry and formal descriptions
examples: Russian sable fur was highly prized by royalty
The sable hunted small rodents in the forest
The knight's shield bore a sable background with gold stars
Her sable hair gleamed in the candlelight

definitions: deliberate destruction of equipment or disruption of processes to prevent normal functioning
examples: Enemy agents attempted sabotage of the power plant
Industrial sabotage cost the company millions in damages

definitions: person who deliberately destroys damages or obstructs something especially for political purposes
examples: The saboteur cut communication lines before the attack
Factory guards watched for potential saboteurs during wartime

definitions: heavy cavalry sword with curved blade and single cutting edge used historically in warfare
examples: The officer's ceremonial sabre hung at his side
Fencers competed with blunt sabres in the tournament

definitions: pouch-like structure in plant or animal body containing fluid or other substances
examples: The spider's egg sac contained hundreds of tiny eggs
Fluid accumulated in the sac causing swelling

definitions: rough woven fabric made from hemp or jute used for making sacks
act of dismissing someone from employment especially done harshly or suddenly
examples: The potatoes were stored in bags made of sacking
Rough sacking material protected plants from frost
The sacking of the manager shocked all employees
Mass sackings followed the company merger announcement

definitions: formal religious ceremony regarded as imparting divine grace such as baptism or communion
examples: The priest administered the sacrament of baptism to infants
Catholics recognize seven sacraments in their faith

definitions: violation or misuse of what is regarded as sacred through disrespect or irreverence
examples: Vandalism of the church was considered terrible sacrilege
Many felt that commercializing the holiday was sacrilege

definitions: leather seat fastened on horse or bicycle for rider to sit on while controlling mount
examples: The cowboy adjusted his saddle before mounting the horse
She bought a comfortable saddle for long bike rides
